install.description:
Now that you've installed Construct, getting started is easy. The 40 included module positions occupy the most commonly used areas within a template. With dynamic width logic, the availability of five columns (including the component area), the numerous module positions and expanded functionality via template parameters, building your unique Joomla website is greatly simplified with this framework. Once you have your content, components and modules in place, just add your unique style.

Adding your unique style is accomplished by adding a custom style sheet to the CSS directory located within Construct. Once created, just open Construct in the Template Manager and select YES next to Use custom style sheet and select the one you added. There is also an example template pack included within this template’s installation archive to help you get you started; just extract the example template pack archive to this template’s directory.

Integrated mobile device detection ensures that all of your visitors get the content they desire. The included mobile version of the template is a great start for serving your mobile audience. It’s fast loading, progressively enhanced with jQuery Mobile and uses a reposive layout to accomidate both mobile and tablet devices.

Allowing even greater flexablity of your design is the ability to add article, menu item, category, section and component specific extended template overrides. Place these appropriately named files in the right folder and the template will load them automatically. For example, to create an extended template override for article 37, add your new layout named article-37.php to /layouts/article and CSS named article-37.css to /css/article.

field.name: setGeneratorTag
field.label: Generator Meta Tag
field.description: Customize the generator meta tag output by your template.

param.name: enableSwitcher
param.label: Layout Aid
param.description: Enable the ajax style sheet switcher to use the diagnostic and wireframe visual layout aids.

param.name: showDiagnostics
param.label: Override Diagnostics
param.description: Enable display of the current article, item, category, section, and component exteneded template override information.

param.name: customStyleSheet
param.label: Custom style sheet
param.description: Name of the style sheet that contains your custom CSS declarations. Default is custom.css.

param.name: setGeneratorTag
param.label: Generator Meta Tag
param.description: Customize the generator meta tag output by your template.

param.name: IECSS3
param.label: Add CSS3 Support to IE
param.description: Enable the use of PIE (http://css3pie.com/) to add CSS3 support to Internet Explorer version 8 and before. Also adds pie_hover class to non-link items on hover. For performance reason, you must define the tagret elements below.

param.name: IECSS3Targets
param.label: IE CSS3 Support Targets
param.description: Enter a comma seprated list of HTML targets to apply PIE to.

param.name: IE6TransFix
param.label: Add IE6 Transparency Fix
param.description: Enable the use DD_belatedPNG (http://www.dillerdesign.com/experiment/DD_belatedPNG/) to add transparentcy support to IE6. For performance reason, you must define the tagret elements below.

param.name: IE6TransFixTargets
param.label: IE6 Transparency Fix Targets
param.description: Enter a comma seprated list of HTML targets to apply DD_belatedPNG to.

param.name: loadMoo
param.label: Load MooTools
param.description: Load the MooTools JavaScript library that is included with Joomla.

param.name: loadModal
param.label: Enable modal pop-ups
param.description: Load the SqueezeBox JavaScript for modals. Requires MooTools to be enabled.

param.name: loadjQuery
param.label: Load jQuery
param.description: Select the version of the jQuery JavaScript library to load, hosted by Google. jQuery will not load if no version is selected.

param.name: gridSystem
param.label: Grid System
param.description: Optionally select the grid system to use. Default is Construct's standard layout. Add other grid system style sheets to templates/construct5-pro/css/grid

param.name: siteWidth
param.label: Site Width
param.description: Define the overall width of the layout. Enter only a number, no units, as you will choose which unit to use below.

param.name: siteWidthType
param.label: Site Width Style
param.description: Set whether to use a fluid max-width or fixed width layout.

param.name: siteWidthUnit
param.label: Site Width Type
param.description: Choose to set the width in relative Ems, Pixels or percentage. Ems are calculated based on their parent element size, where the body font size is approximately 12px.

param.name: fluidMedia
param.label: Fluid Media
param.description: Enable for fluid image and object resizing when using a fluid layout. NOTE: Do not specify widths in the source-code as this option enables an img, object {max-width:100%} declaration

param.name: fullWidth
param.label: Full Width Elements
param.description: Should the header and footer expand to be the full width of the browser viewport or be constrained to the same width defined above.

param.name: useStickyFooter
param.label: Use CSS Sticky Footer
param.description: Enable the use a CSS Sticky Footer, which requires a fixed height. Dynamic content of varying sizes may require special attention when using this.

param.name: stickyFooterHeight
param.label: Sticky Footer Height
param.description: Set the fixed height, in pixels, of your sticky footer.

param.name: mdetect
param.label: Mobile Device Detection
param.description: Enable automatic detecion of mobile devices and load a mobile version of the template.

param.name: detectTablets
param.label: Include Tablet Devices
param.description: Include tablet devices in the mobile detection and load the mobile version of the temeplate.

param.name: mNavPosition
param.label: Navigation Position
param.description: Placement of the navigation, in relation to the main content area.

param.name: mPageDataTheme
param.label: Page Theme
param.description: The jQuery Mobile swatch theme to apply to the page portion of the mobile template. See http://jquerymobile.com/test/docs/api/themes.html for more details.

param.name: mHeaderDataTheme
param.label: Header Theme
param.description: The jQuery Mobile swatch theme to apply to the header portion of the mobile template.

param.name: mNavDataTheme
param.label: Navigation Theme
param.description: The jQuery Mobile swatch theme to apply to the navigation portion of the mobile template.

param.name: mContentDataTheme
param.label: Content Theme
param.description: The jQuery Mobile swatch theme to apply to the content portion of the mobile template.

param.name: mFooterDataTheme
param.label: Footer Theme
param.description: The jQuery Mobile swatch theme to apply to the footer portion of the mobile template.

param.description: The Google Web font to be applied to the designated targets below. Visit http://code.google.com/webfonts for more information.

param.label: Google Web Font Targets
param.description: A comma seperated list of the html elements, CSS IDs, and classes to apply the selected Google Web Font to. If targeting the body, be sure to set the Body Font Family to None Selected.

param.label: Google Web Font Size
param.description: Define the font size, including the unit of measure, of the font family defined above. Percentage is preferred. NOTE: Construct's base typography uses a font size of 76%, which is 12px in most modern browsers.
